person.persName: Henry Cornelius Burnett (Kentucky attorney and politician)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, politician, and soldier. Essex County, Kentucky, native. Son of Isaac Burnett and Martha Garnett Burnett. Married to Mary A. Terry Burnett in Trigg County, Kentucky, on May 13th, 1847. Father of Mary Burnett, Muscoe Burnett, and Henry Burnett. Educated at common schools and a Hopkinsville academy. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1847. Attorney in Cadiz, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Clerk of the Trigg County Court in Trigg County from 1851 to 1853. Member of the House of Representatives of the United States of American representing the First Congressional District of Kentucky from 1855 to his expulsion on December 3, 1861. Owned seven enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Colonel in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from November 11, 1861, to February 10, 1862. President of the Russellville Convention in November 1861. Representative of the Provisional Confederate Congress from 1861 to 1862. Senator in the First and Second Confederate Congresses of Kentucky from February 19, 1862, to February 18, 1865.
